project_description: A simple Flutter app that toggles between displaying 'Cat' and 'Dog' text with corresponding icons when clicked.
architecture_overview: The project follows a clean architecture with a clear separation of concerns. The Cubit pattern is used for state management, ensuring a reactive and maintainable codebase. The project is highly modularized, with separate folders for screens, cubits, models, and widgets.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The main entry point of the Flutter application. Sets up the BlocProvider and initializes the app.

files.name: lib/screens/home_screen.dart
files.description: Contains the HomeScreen widget which displays the AnimalWidget.

cubits.name: AnimalCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state of the animal being displayed, toggling between Cat and Dog.

dependencies.purpose: Base framework for building the application.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: click
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: update state
AnimalCubit -> AnimalWidget: new state
@enduml
state_management_flow: The AnimalCubit manages the state of the current animal (Cat or Dog). When the user clicks on the AnimalWidget, it triggers the toggleAnimal method in AnimalCubit, which updates the state. The new state is then reflected in the AnimalWidget.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen, which contains the AnimalWidget. The navigation structure is simple and straightforward with no additional screens or navigation logic.
